job description:
The Data Scientist will produce innovative solutions driven by exploratory data analysis from complex and high-dimensional datasets. By applying their knowledge of statistics, machine learning, data mining and modeling, programming, predictive modeling, simulation, forecasting and advanced mathematics, the individual in this role will be responsible for recognizing patterns, identifying opportunities, asking business questions and interpreting data while working on projects in the clinical drug trial industry. The successful candidate will use a flexible, analytical approach to design, develop, and evaluate predictive models while working with a team of internal subject matter experts on government and commercial projects.

The ideal candidate will possess strong interpersonal and collaboration skills as well as solid oral and written communication and presentation skills. Also important is the ability to think creatively and to quickly and easily learn new open source software as technologies emerge. Lastly, possessing strong pattern recognition and predictive modeling skills will contribute to the effectiveness of this role.
  • Design, develop and program methods, processes and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured diverse "big data" sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement
  • Along with a team of subject matter experts, participate in projects and tasks related to data integration, data cleaning, descriptive analyses, exploratory analyses, predictive modeling, data mining, text analytics, social media analytics, social network analysis, rapid prototyping, and data visualization to solve problems
  • Develop predictive models and simulations using a variety of software and tools
  • Develop and code software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources
  • Identify meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources and interpret and communicate insights and findings from analysis and experiments to internal stakeholders
  • Use software and/or database to gather, store, access, manipulate, and analyze research data from a variety of sources
  • May be involved in sequence and structural analysis, data mining, or statistical modeling
  • Implement new statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis
  • Perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, and uncover noteworthy trends and relationships
  • Analyze and model structured data and implement algorithms to support analysis using advanced statistical and mathematical methods from statistics, data mining, econometrics, and operations research
  • Master's degree in data science, statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, analytics, or related field is preferred including a strong mathematical background
  • 2 years of relevant experience - clinical trials preferred
  • Experience with modern software environments used in advanced analytics and data visualization, such as R or Python
  • Proficiency using relevant software packages for statistical analyses and visualization
  • Experience with extracting, merging and analyzing data from a wide variety of sources (e.g., relational databases, text unstructured files, sensor data, image and video files)
  • Experience with static and/or interactive data visualization methods
  • Experience with techniques and technologies for accessing and analyzing "big data"
  • Background in data mining and statistical analysis
  • Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data tranformation
  • Strong quantitative analysis background and experience in working with large, complex data systems to aggregate, organize, and prepare data for use in business analysis
  • Experience in extracting, cleaning, preparing and modeling data
  • Experience with command-line scripting, data structures, and algorithms
  • Experience with a compiled programming language
  • Experience with web technologies
  • Familiarity with SQL and NoSQL databases
  • Experience in cluster and cloud computing environments
